intro: Chaptalia fibrosa, commonly known as the fibrous chaptalia, is a flowering plant native to the Andes region of South America. It belongs to the family Asteraceae, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant is known for its fibrous, woody stems and narrow, lance-shaped leaves. It produces small, yellowish flowers that bloom in late summer, attracting various pollinators. Due to its unique morphology and habitat, it is of interest to botanists and conservationists.
